title: IRSA releases 296,700 cusecs water
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 11 (APP):Indus River System Authority (IRSA) on Thursday released 296,700 cusecs water from various rim stations with inflow of 349,300 cusecs.
According to the data released by IRSA, water level in River Indus at Tarbela Dam was 1520.06 feet and was 122.06 feet higher than its dead level of 1,398 feet. Water inflow and outflow in the dam was recorded as 174,000 cusecs and 135,000 cusecs respectively.
The water level in River Jhelum at Mangla Dam was 1193.45 feet, which was 145.45 feet higher than its dead level of 1,050 feet. The inflow and outflow of water was recorded 40,600 cusecs and 27,000 cusecs respectively.
The release of water at Kalabagh, Taunsa , Guddu and Sukkur was recorded as 201,400, 178,800, 142,400 and 70,000 cusecs respectively.
Similarly, from River Kabul, a total of 67,200 cusecs of water released at Nowshera and 35,600 cusecs released from River Chenab at Marala.
